taskbody.context: You can filter a work order in the Released and Completed page in the application based on the filter criteria you select. For example, you can filter all the work orders in the Ready status in the Released page.

step.cmd: In the Order Management page, select a line in the Line drop-down list box.
step.stepresult: The Released page appears, displaying a list of work orders associated with the selected line.

step.cmd: Select for a field, and then select the filter options as described in the following table.

chrow.chdesc: Select to view the work orders for all the fields.
Select to view the work order for a specific column. <work_order_data> is the row value you select in a column for a work order.

chdesc.p: Enter a value in the Search box to search for a work order by the <work_order_data> name. As you enter characters in the Search box, the field values list is automatically filtered to display only values that contain the search text.The matched field values are not case-sensitive. A message appears if no field value is available corresponding to the entered search text.

info.note: Select Cancel to delete your selections and go back to the previous page.

taskbody.result: The work orders based on the specified filter criteria appear in the selected page and the applied filter indicator appears for the field. You can apply filters on multiple fields in a page to refine the filtered data.To clear a filter applied on a field, select for the field on which you want to remove the filter. Then, in the window containing the list of field values, clear the selected check boxes, and then select OK. You can also select to modify the applied filter on a field.
